body:
I think the issue is where you are placing the event-loop shim.

I hacked up a hello-world example to use your config shown below, and it seems like things were working:

app.py
```
from __future__ import print_function

from gevent import monkey
monkey.patch_all()

import grpc.experimental.gevent
grpc.experimental.gevent.init_gevent()

import grpc

import helloworld_pb2
import helloworld_pb2_grpc

import flask


app = flask.Flask( __name__ )


@app.route( '/' )
def handle_root():
  channel = grpc.insecure_channel('localhost:50051')
  stub = helloworld_pb2_grpc.GreeterStub(channel)
  response = stub.SayHello(helloworld_pb2.HelloRequest(name='you'))
  return response.message
```

Note the placement of the monkey-patch.  Can you try doing the same thing with your app?

Here you are:
[arch_002.zip](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/files/1916856/arch_002.zip)

Looks correct?

Nothing has changed, actually. Or, better say, you hit the nail on the head. Not sure.
Note in my code I've added the following line after the patch
```
print( 'GRPC patched' )
```

Steps:
- start app by `PORT=8000 honcho start`
- get by `curl localhost:8000`

`curl` gives me: `curl: (52) Empty reply from server`
App gives me:
```

19:01:16 system     | gunicorn.1 stopped (rc=0)

```

If I get rid of the patch and use `grpcio==1.3.0` all works fine (more or less, you know).

Does it help?

I guess it doesn't.
At least it doesn't work to me. Even v1.12.0.
Anyway `gunicorn` worker gets frozen.

Aren't you too fast in closing issue which has been stalled for 1.5m?
I've seen no help yet.
Your _hello world_ works, mine doesn't.
It's good opportunity to close most of the issues.
Pity musings.

I apologize for closing this out prematurely, it wasn't clear to me that this was still an issue.

I'm now convinced that this is a real issue, and have created a PR to fix it.

1.12.1 has been pushed, and should fix this issue.

Please re-open if it is still a problem.

The flight seems ok for now.
Thank you very much.

BTW, I've finally decided to use custom Gunicorn worker class to patch GRPC.
```
import gunicorn.workers.ggevent


class CustomGeventWorker( gunicorn.workers.ggevent.GeventWorker ):

    def patch( self ):

        super( CustomGeventWorker, self ).patch()

        import grpc._cython.cygrpc
        grpc._cython.cygrpc.init_grpc_gevent()
        self.log.info( 'CustomGeventWorker.patch: patched grpc' )

```
